alert.note: Alert for Jones; Onslow; Pamlico (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 9:16PM EST until December 18 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Carteret, Craven, Jones, Onslow, Pamlico and Pitt. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Bern, James City, Trent Woods, River Bend, South River, Merrimon, Blounts Creek, Vanceboro, Cayton, Askins, Lowland, Florence, Tuscarora, Jasper, Olympia, Grantsboro, Edward, Royal, Bonnerton and Riverdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
